edu.cmu.sei.arche.corebridge.facade
Class ArchEFacade

java.lang.Object
  edu.cmu.sei.arche.corebridge.facade.ArchEFacade
public class ArchEFacade
extends java.lang.Object

The Facade resolves calls to the ArchE Core and passes the centrally located Rete Object to the function calls.

Author:
Neel Mullick

Field Detail

INDEX_OF_PART_IN_SCENARIO_ARRAY

public static final int[] INDEX_OF_PART_IN_SCENARIO_ARRAY
In ScenarioInteractions, the data fields of a scenario are store in an array. This constant defines what is the position of each scenario part within that array.

See Also:
ScenarioInteractions.ScenarioInteractions()
Constructor Detail

ArchEFacade

public ArchEFacade()
Initializes the objects responsible for actually interacting with the ArchE Core.

Method Detail

startupArchE

public void startupArchE(java.lang.String fileProject,
                         IRefreshableUI ui,
                         ProjectVO project,
                         java.util.List designElementTypes,
                         java.util.List designRelationTypes)
                  throws ArchEException
Resolves the project startup command to the startupRete method. The Rete object to be centrally located is returned by the startupRete method.

Parameters:
fileProject - Complete filename of the project persisted fact base file to be batch loaded / executed
ui - represents the UI layer that is currently displaying the data of the factbase that will accessed by this facade instance. The reference to the UI is needed further ahead by the VO objects so that they know what UI to call to flag views to refresh.
project - The ProjectVO object is the entry point to access all the facts in memory. VOUpdate will later on need this reference so that when a new fact is asserted/modified/retracted, we can add/change/remove the corresponding VO to this project.
designElementTypes - List of design element type definitions
designRelationTypes - List of design relation type definitions
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - in case it's trying to startup project that is already started
ArchEException - in case Jess could not start the project.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if ui or project is null

addResponsibility

public void addResponsibility(java.lang.String descriptionSlot)
Resolves the addResponsbility command to the assertResponsibility method The centrally located Rete object is passed to the assertResponsibility method

Parameters:
descriptionSlot - The string description slot of the fact.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this method is called before starting up

addResponsbilityParameter

public void addResponsbilityParameter(java.lang.String paramName,
                                      int ownerSlot,
                                      java.lang.String valueSlot,
                                      int dataType)
Resolves the addResponsbilityParameter command to the assertResponsibilityParameter method The centrally located Rete object is passed to the assertResponsibilityParameter method

Parameters:
paramName - The name of the parameter - maps to a fact in the ArchE Core.
ownerSlot - The integer owner (parent) slot of the fact.
valueSlot - The string value slot of the fact.
dataType - The parameter value can be any one of string, boolean or float. This is a constant that lets us know which data type value is to be asserted.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this method is called before starting up

editResponsibility

public void editResponsibility(ResponsibilityVO voRInitial,
                               java.lang.String descriptionSlot)
Resolves the editResponsibility command to the modifyResponsibility method The centrally located Rete object is passed to the modifyResponsibility method

Parameters:
voRInitial - the original Responsbility Value Object
descriptionSlot - The modified string description slot of the fact.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this method is called before starting up

editResponsbilityParameter

public void editResponsbilityParameter(ParameterVO voParamInitial,
                                       int ownerSlotI,
                                       int ownerSlotM,
                                       java.lang.String valueSlotM,
                                       int dataType)
Resolves the editResponsbilityParameter command to the modifyResponsibilityParameter method The centrally located Rete object is passed to the modifyResponsibilityParameter method

Parameters:
voParamInitial - the original Parameter Value Object
ownerSlotI - The initial integer owner (parent) slot of the fact.
ownerSlotM - The modified integer owner (parent) slot of the fact.
valueSlotM - The modified string value slot of the fact.
dataType - The parameter value can be any one of string, boolean or float. This is a constant that lets us know which data type value is to be asserted.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this method is called before starting up

Parameters:
applyToSlotD - the fact Id of the Responsbility that is to be deleted.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this method is called before starting up

                             int childSlot,

typeSlot - The string that represents the type of the relationship.

                              int parentSlotM,

addScFnRespoRelation

public void addScFnRespoRelation(int parentSlot,
                                 int childSlot)
Resolves the addScFnRespoRelation command to the assertScFnRespoRelation method The centrally located Rete object is passed to the assertScFnRespoRelation method

Parameters:
parentSlot - The integer factId that is the parent (scenario/fucntion) in the relationship.
childSlot - The integer factId that is the child (responsibility) in the relationship.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this method is called before starting up

editScFnRespoRelation

public void editScFnRespoRelation(int applyToSlot,
                                  int parentSlotM,
                                  int childSlotM)
Resolves the editScFnRespoRelation command to the modifyScFnRespoRelation method The centrally located Rete object is passed to the modifyScFnRespoRelation method

Parameters:
applyToSlot - The initial integer factId that is the parent (scenario/function) in the relationship. This will be the fact id of the initial translation relation that will now be retracted from the core and replaced with a new translation relation.
parentSlotM - The modified integer factId that is the parent (scenario/function) in the relationship.
childSlotM - The modified integer factId that is the child (responsibility) in the relationship.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this method is called before starting up

deleteScFnRespoRelation

public void deleteScFnRespoRelation(int applyToSlot)
Resolves the deleteScFnRespoRelation command to the retractScFnRespoRelation method The centrally located Rete object is passed to the retractScFnRespoRelation method

Parameters:
applyToSlot - The integer (parent-scenario/function) factId for which the (translation) relationship is to be deleted.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this method is called before starting up

shutdownArchE

public void shutdownArchE()
Resolves the call to close the project after saving the persisted fact base to the shutdownRete method. Fact base is persisted.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this method is called before starting up or if trying to shutdown a project that was not up.

saveArchE

public void saveArchE()
Resolves the call to save the project to the shutdownRete method. Fact base is persisted. The Core is not halted.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this method is called before starting up or if trying to shutdown a project that was not up.

closeArchE

public void closeArchE()
Resolves the call to shutdown the Core without saving the persistent fact base to the shutdownRete method. Fact base is not persisted. The Core is halted.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this method is called before starting up or if trying to shutdown a project that was not up.

Returns the baseLocation.

addScenario

public void addScenario(java.lang.String[] scenario)
Resolves the addScenario command to the assertScenario method The centrally located Rete object is passed to the assertScenario method

Parameters:
scenario - The string arrays of all the contents of a scenario.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this method is called before starting up

thinkScenario

public java.lang.String[] thinkScenario(java.lang.String[] scenario)
Resolves the thinkScenario command to the assertScenario and thinkScenario method. The centrally located Rete object is passed to the assertScenario method. There's no need to refresh the views because 'think' doesn't change the data being displayed on the views.

Parameters:
scenario - The string arrays of all the contents of a scenario.
Returns:
arrScenario The String array that contatins the processes (though about!) scenario.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this method is called before starting up

applyToSlotM - The Scenario Fact Id which is to be modified.

java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this method is called before starting up

description - The description of the new function.

java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this method is called before starting up

editFunction

public void editFunction(int applyToFactId,
                         java.lang.String id,
                         java.lang.String description)
Changes id and/or description of a function in ArchE core using the corresponding assert method in the interactions layer.

Parameters:
applyToFactId - fact id of the function to be edited
id - The new value for the ID of the function.
description - The new value for the description of the new function.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this method is called before starting up

deleteFunction

public void deleteFunction(int applyToFactId)
Delete a function in ArchE core using the corresponding assert method in the interactions layer.

Parameters:
applyToFactId - fact id of the function to be deleted
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this method is called before starting up

answerQuestion

public void answerQuestion(QuestionToUserVO questionVo)
The user has answerd a question. The QuestionToUserVO object contains both the question and the answer. We simply change the question in the fact base. ArchE Core takes care of removing the question once it's answered.

Parameters:
questionVo -

getSlotValue

public java.lang.String getSlotValue(int factId,
                                     java.lang.String slotName)
gets the value (string contents) for a given slot of a fact in the core.

Parameters:
factId - The integer FactId of the fact in the Core.
slotName - The string slot for which the value needs ot be read.
Returns:
The String value (contents) of the given slot for the fact found using the Id.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this method is called before starting up

writeFacts

public void writeFacts(java.lang.String fileName)
Writes the XML file containing all the facts, their slots and values from the core to an XML file which will be converted into the UML design XMI file using XSLT.

getEngineArchE

public jess.Rete getEngineArchE()
Used by Jess Console to hook up the Rete object to the UI.

Returns:
Returns the engineArchE.
